H0.text: Hydrogen is the most abundant element in the universe.

H1.text: Oxygen is the most abundant element in the universe.

H2.text: Carbon is the most abundant element in the universe.

H3.text: Helium is the most abundant element in the universe.

A4.text: Hydrogen is the lightest and most abundant chemical element in the universe, constituting about 75% of all normal matter.

A5.text: Hydrogen is the most abundant element in the universe, making up 75% of normal matter by mass and >90% by number of atoms.
